content.description:
Just to the right of "Slow-speed Chase". An imposing roof move above the first bolt prompted us to install a fixed draw for the crux. Look for the "golden draw" at the second clip.

Climb up an easy ramp to make a clip under a roof. Position yourself for the fixed clip just above the roof, then "ride the bronco" to bolts above.

Some mixed but well-protected 5.10 climbing above keeps the interest, as does the final dihedral to the anchors.
content.protection:
8 bolts, gear to .5", Mussy hooks.

Lower off.
content.location: Start under the rightmost roof at the base of the buttress.

content.description:
P1 (5.10b) MIXED-100': Climb past a bolt to a roof, then place an optional .75". Step left and place a 2" piece under the first roof. Move left past the first corner, then clip a bolt above. Move left again and then right onto a slab. Climb the sustained, bolted slab to a ramp and a final layback past a fixed draw to the anchors.

P2 (5.7) MIXED-175': Continue up easier mixed terrain, passing a set of rappel rings. A final bolted face (crux) delivers you to anchors.

P3 (5.9) MIXED-70': Traverse left and up to a gear-protected dihedral, capped by a small bulge and a bolt.
content.protection:
14 runners with a couple long ones, singles to 3.5".

4 rappels with a 70-meter rope.
content.location: Leftmost route. Look for a ramp with a bolt at 15'.

content.description:
Scramble up a short optional-gear dihedral then step left to clip a bolt. Pull through a roof then continue up an easy ramp to a steeper face (crux). Pull through, and continue up fun climbing to anchors.

Longer than it looks!
content.protection:
8 bolts, 1-2 pieces to .25" for the initial dihedral, Mussy hooks.

Lower off.
content.location: An obvious path to a nice ledge just above Cheesy Puff marks the start for this route and JudgIto.

content.description: This route is a 2nd pitch variation to the Moose is loose.
content.protection:
Single rack for first pitch of Moose is loose. Bring along some extra hand sizes.

10 Quickdraws for Juice is loose. Lower off, back down to the second pitch anchor. 60m rope just makes it. Knot your ends.
content.location: Approach OJ Buttress and skirt the toe around to the left side. Hand cracks and flakes for "Moose" are obvious.

content.description:
A good variety of crack climbing on this one, with some featured patina face in the middle. Pitch 1 follows a hand crack in a V shaped flare. Jamming, stemming and a little chimney technique gets you to a short but steep flake section.  Step left, clip a bolt and move up the feature face to 2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 2 continues up the featured face, past a bolt to the base of a left facing dihedral.  From here, work up and right to a thin crack through a bulge (crux, green or yellow alien).  Continue up this crack, staying right of the large bush.  The crack enters a small corner, with a cruxy bolt protected move.  2 bolt anchor above.
content.protection: Doubles to #3 camalot and a few extra small cams. Two raps with a 60 m to descend.
content.location: 20 yards uphill (lookers left) from the large orange roof.  Starts in a V shaped flare that is more fun than it looks.

content.description: From the ledge, climb up and left to gain a fun groove through the slab. Continue up a short techy face to an arete. Balance your way up the arete (crux) to a shallow ramp. Continue up and right, then back left to anchors.
content.protection: 10 bolts, Mussy hooks. Rappel with a 70-meter rope or join Judgito for 2 more pitches.
content.location: Continue up the buttress to a fixed rope. Climb the fixed rope and continue up to a dirt ledge supported by rebar and lumber. A belay bolt is available.

content.description:
*Update 5/24/18: An additional 5 bolts have been added to link this climb to two more moderate pitches above (previously the upper pitches of "Mimosa").*

aka "Pine Creek two-step".

P1:  (5.8) SPORT/10 or 15 bolts/110' or 150' Scramble up and right in a gully to the first bolt. Clip two more bolts then get your slab on. Continue up easier terrain to a bulge, then continue left to a sting in the tail. Lower from here, or continue past the anchors and 5 more bolts to an open belay left of the "Mimosa" anchors.

P2: (5.7) SPORT/10 bolts/105': Move left, clip a bolt then mantle onto easy slab. Continue up fun, easy climbing. A short jug-haul delivers you to anchors and an cool stance below a dihedral.

P3: (5.9) SPORT/6 bolts/60': Climb the fun dihedral capped by a roof, then continue up easier terrain to the anchors. Great position with fun moves.
content.protection:
Bolts, Mussy hooks.

Lower or rappel. If linking up the upper pitches rappel from the Mimosa anchors just to the right of the first pitch open belay/ledge.
content.location: Same start as Oompa Loompa. Look for bolts to the right of dihedral.

content.description:
P1 (5.10c) 9 bolts/110' (first pitch:***): Climb past 3 bolts through the initial face, then up easier terrain to the steep head-wall. Engaging climbing brings you to the crux just below the anchors. Pull the small roof to the anchor stance.

P2 (5.8) 11 bolts/110': Climb up and right on ramp to a short headwall, climb through that to easier ground. Continue up the featured head-wall to the anchors.
content.protection:
11 bolts, Mussy hooks.

2 rappels with a 70-meter rope.
content.location: From the platform that marks the start of Mimosa, scramble up to a triangular wooden ledge above. Set up belay, then continue up the easy ramp to the first bolt.

content.description:
Start in the right hand chimney, past 2 closely placed bolts.  Featured chimney climbing leads to easier ground.  From here, stem across to the wall on the right.  Steeper, juggy climbing leads to an anchor.

See "Guilty as Charged" for topo photo and description.

The clean, left hand, left leaning chimney.  Follow a 3rd class rib to the first bolt.  The chimney tightens down at the second bolt.  Third is a bit hard to see while leading but can be felt on the right side of the chimney.  A cruxy move leads to easier chimenying above. This route is somewhat hard to clean while leading, better to have the second clean it on TR.
content.location: Follow directions to OJ buttress from the parking lot used to access Three Hour Arete, etc.  From the large orange roof at the OJ Buttress, follow a faint trail up and right.  Do not use the fixed cord for Jersey Tan continue up a right to the base of the chimneys. These are the highest two routes and slightly right of the main wall.

content.description:
The eye-catching serrated splitter directly across from Sunflower Tower.

Battle the overhanging hand to finger crack as it cuts wildly through an exposed arete. Engage the face above to the anchor with fixed steelies.

The legendary lightsaber, a deep almost impossible black blade with a glowing white edge. The wielder's thoughts flow through the crystal, use the Force to guide the blade's power.
content.location: Park for Lamb Canyon and hike west towards OJ Buttress. Turn right and head up a decent trail in the gully to Sunflower Tower, which is an excellent warm-up route.

content.description: Climb fun features to a stance below a blank-looking slab. Get your slab on, then continue up easier terrain to anchors. Longer than it looks.
content.location: Start on a levelled platform just uphill from the toe of the buttress. A 6-foot spear of rock with a bolt above marks the start.
